Name: Crucifix
Description: Symbolizes the sacrifice of Jesus Christ for humanity's salvation.

Name: Rosary
Description: A tool for prayer and meditation, consisting of beads and a cross or medal.

Name: Cross
Description: Represents faith, redemption, and the triumph of good over evil.

Name: Ichthys (Fish Symbol)
Description: Signifies Christ and the Christian faith.

Name: Dove
Description: Symbolizing the Holy Spirit and peace.

Name: Alpha and Omega
Description: Represents the beginning and the end, symbolizing God's eternal nature.

Name: Chi-Rho
Description: Combining the first two letters of "Christ" in Greek, representing Jesus Christ.

Name: Lamb
Description: Symbolizing Christ as the sacrificial lamb and the Good Shepherd.

Name: Sacred Heart
Description: Represents Jesus' divine love and compassion for humanity.

Name: Piece of the True Cross
Description: Relic believed to be part of the cross on which Jesus was crucified.

Name: Shroud of Turin
Description: Cloth believed to bear the image of Jesus' face, associated with his burial.

Name: Holy Grail
Description: Legendary cup used by Jesus at the Last Supper, sought after for its sacred significance.

Name: Veil of Veronica
Description: Cloth believed to bear the imprint of Jesus' face, associated with his Passion.

Name: Holy Lance
Description: Spear used by a Roman soldier to pierce Jesus' side during the Crucifixion.

Name: Crown of Thorns
Description: Relic believed to be part of the crown worn by Jesus during his Passion.

Name: Saint's Relic
Description: Relic associated with a specific saint, such as bones, clothing, or personal items.

Name: Eucharistic Miracle
Description: Relic associated with a miraculous manifestation of the Eucharist, such as bleeding hosts or incorruptible bread.

Name: Martyr's Relic
Description: Relic associated with a Christian martyr, representing their sacrifice and witness to the faith.

Name: Icon Relic
Description: Relic associated with a sacred icon, believed to possess spiritual power and protection.

Name: Holy Water
Description: Water blessed by a priest, used for purification and spiritual protection.

Name: Monstrance
Description: Ornate vessel used to display and honor the consecrated Eucharist during adoration.

Name: Crown of Glory
Description: Symbol of eternal reward and victory in heaven, often depicted in Christian art.

Name: Tabernacle
Description: Ornate container used to store the consecrated Eucharist in Catholic churches.

Name: Chalice
Description: Cup used to hold the wine during the Eucharistic celebration, representing the blood of Christ.

Name: Paten
Description: Plate used to hold the bread during the Eucharistic celebration, representing the body of Christ.

Name: Ciborium
Description: Container used to hold consecrated hosts for distribution during Communion.

Name: Reliquary
Description: Ornate container used to enshrine relics of saints or holy objects for veneration.

Name: Holy Oil
Description: Oil blessed by a bishop, used in sacramental rituals such as anointing the sick and baptizing.

Name: Cincture
Description: Cord worn around the waist by clergy and religious, symbolizing chastity and commitment to service.
